SENT.plain: A 45-year-old man was hospitalized for syncope due to fascicular ventricular tachycardia degenerating into ventricular fibrillation (VF)
The electrocardiogram showed an early repolarization syndrome
The arrhythmia was repetitive and disappeared after oral hydroquinidine
An implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) was implanted; subsequently, the patient was arrhythmia free at 9 months follow-up
